verses.kjv: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem, and were come to Bethphage, unto the mount of Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,
verses.ct: As they approached Jerusalem and reached Bethphage near the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent 2 disciples ahead.

verses.kjv: Saying unto them, Go into the village over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose them, and bring them unto me.
verses.ct: He told them, "Go into the village just ahead of you. Right away you'll find a donkey tied up with her colt beside her. Untie them and bring them to me.

verses.kjv: And if any man say ought unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.
verses.ct: If anyone questions you, just say, 'The Lord needs them,' and they will let you take them immediately."

verses.kjv: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: This happened to fulfill what the prophet had spoken:

verses.kjv: Tell ye the daughter of Sion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek, and sitting upon an ass, and a colt the foal of an ass.
verses.ct: "Say to the daughter of Sion, 'Look, your King is coming to you, humble and riding on a donkey — on a colt, the offspring of a donkey.'"

verses.kjv: And the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them,
verses.ct: The disciples went and did exactly what Jesus had instructed them.

verses.kjv: And brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and they set him thereon.
verses.ct: They brought the donkey and the colt, draped their cloaks over them, and Jesus sat on them.

verses.kjv: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way; others cut down branches from the trees, and strawed them in the way.
verses.ct: A massive crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and laid them along the path.

verses.kjv: And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the son of David: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.
verses.ct: The crowds walking ahead of him and those following behind kept shouting, "Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!"

verses.kjv: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, Who is this?
verses.ct: When Jesus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was buzzing with excitement. "Who is this?" people asked.

verses.kjv: And the multitude said, This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee.
verses.ct: The crowds answered, "This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee."

verses.kjv: And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves,
verses.ct: Jesus went into the temple of God and drove out everyone who was buying and selling there. He flipped over the tables of the money changers and knocked over the chairs of those selling doves.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.
verses.ct: He told them, "Scripture says, 'My house will be called a house of prayer,' but you have turned it into a hideout for criminals."

verses.kjv: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he healed them.
verses.ct: Then blind and disabled people came to him in the temple, and he healed them.

verses.kjv: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children crying in the temple, and saying, Hosanna to the son of David; they were sore displeased,
verses.ct: But when the chief priests and the religious scholars saw the amazing things he was doing, and heard the children shouting in the temple, "Hosanna to the Son of David!" they were furious.

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Hearest thou what these say? And Jesus saith unto them, Yea; have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?
verses.ct: They demanded, "Do you hear what these children are saying?" Jesus replied, "Yes. Haven't you ever read, 'From the mouths of children and infants you have drawn perfect praise'?"

verses.kjv: And he left them, and went out of the city into Bethany; and he lodged there.
verses.ct: Then he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.

verses.kjv: Now in the morning as he returned into the city, he hungered.
verses.ct: Early the next morning, as he was heading back to the city, he was hungry.

verses.kjv: And when he saw a fig tree in the way, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said unto it, Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever. And presently the fig tree withered away.
verses.ct: He noticed a fig tree by the road and went over to it, but found nothing on it except leaves. He said to it, "May you never produce fruit again." Immediately the fig tree dried up.

verses.kjv: And when the disciples saw it, they marvelled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered away!
verses.ct: When the disciples saw this, they were amazed. "How did the fig tree wither so quickly?" they asked.

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; it shall be done.
verses.ct: Jesus answered them, "Truly I tell you, if you have faith and don't doubt, you will not only do what was done to this fig tree, but you could even say to this mountain, 'Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,' and it would happen.

verses.kjv: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.
verses.ct: Whatever you ask for in prayer with genuine belief, you will receive."

verses.kjv: And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?
verses.ct: When Jesus entered the temple and began teaching, the chief priests and elders of the people approached him and demanded, "What authority do you have to do these things? Who gave you this authority?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "I'll ask you one question too. If you answer me, then I'll tell you by what authority I do these things.

verses.kjv: The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven, or of men? And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say unto us, Why did ye not then believe him?
verses.ct: John's baptism — where did it come from? From heaven, or from human origin?" They discussed it among themselves: "If we say, 'From heaven,' he'll ask us, 'Then why didn't you believe him?'

verses.kjv: But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.
verses.ct: But if we say, 'From human origin,' we have the crowd to worry about, since everyone considers John a prophet."

verses.kjv: And they answered Jesus, and said, We cannot tell. And he said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
verses.ct: So they answered Jesus, "We don't know." He replied, "Then I'm not going to tell you by what authority I do these things either."

verses.kjv: But what think ye? A certain man had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work to day in my vineyard.
verses.ct: "But what do you think about this? A man had 2 sons. He went to the first and said, 'Son, go work in my vineyard today.'

verses.kjv: He answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.
verses.ct: The son answered, 'No, I won't.' But later he changed his mind and went.

verses.kjv: And he came to the second, and said likewise. And he answered and said, I go, sir: and went not.
verses.ct: Then the father went to the second son and made the same request. This one answered, 'Sure, sir,' but never went.

verses.kjv: Whether of them twain did the will of his father? They say unto him, The first. Jesus saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.
verses.ct: Which of the 2 did what his father wanted?" They answered, "The first one." Jesus said to them, "Truly I tell you, tax collectors and prostitutes are entering the kingdom of God ahead of you.

verses.kjv: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not: but the publicans and the harlots believed him: and ye, when ye had seen it, repented not afterward, that ye might believe him.
verses.ct: Because John came to you showing the path of righteousness, and you didn't believe him. But tax collectors and prostitutes believed him. And even after you saw that, you still refused to change your minds and believe him.

verses.kjv: Hear another parable: There was a certain householder, which planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and digged a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country:
verses.ct: "Listen to another parable. A landowner planted a vineyard, put a wall around it, dug a winepress in it, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to tenant farmers and traveled to a distant country.

verses.kjv: And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, that they might receive the fruits of it.
verses.ct: When harvest season arrived, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his share of the crop.

verses.kjv: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.
verses.ct: But the tenants grabbed his servants — they beat one, killed another, and threw stones at a third until he died.

verses.kjv: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they did unto them likewise.
verses.ct: So he sent another group of servants, even more than the first time, and the tenants treated them the same way.

verses.kjv: But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.
verses.ct: Finally, he sent his own son, thinking, 'They will respect my son.'

verses.kjv: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.
verses.ct: But when the tenants saw the son coming, they said to each other, 'This is the heir! Let's kill him and take his inheritance for ourselves.'

verses.kjv: And they caught him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and slew him.
verses.ct: So they grabbed him, dragged him out of the vineyard, and killed him.

verses.kjv: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?
verses.ct: Now, when the owner of the vineyard returns, what will he do to those tenants?"

verses.kjv: They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall render him the fruits in their seasons.
verses.ct: They answered, "He will bring those evil men to a terrible end and lease the vineyard to other tenants who will give him his share of the harvest at the proper time."

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner: this is the Lord’s doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "Have you never read in the Scriptures: 'The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone. This is the Lord's doing, and it is remarkable to us'?

verses.kjv: Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.
verses.ct: That is why I tell you, the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.

verses.kjv: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.
verses.ct: Whoever falls on this stone will be shattered, and whoever it falls on will be crushed to dust."

verses.kjv: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.
verses.ct: When the chief priests and Pharisees heard his parables, they realized he was talking about them.

verses.kjv: But when they sought to lay hands on him, they feared the multitude, because they took him for a prophet.
verses.ct: They wanted to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowds, because the people regarded Jesus as a prophet.
